definitions.definition: A surface-active agent , or wetting agent , capable of reducing the surface tension of a liquid ; typically organic compounds having a hydrophilic “ head ” and a hydrophobic “ tail ”.
A lipoprotein in the tissues of the lung that reduces surface tension and permits more efficient gas transport .

main_definition: ( chemistry ) A surface-active agent , or wetting agent , capable of reducing the surface tension of a liquid ; typically organic compounds having a hydrophilic “ head ” and a hydrophobic “ tail ”.
secondary_definitions: ( biochemistry ) A lipoprotein in the tissues of the lung that reduces surface tension and permits more efficient gas transport .
